1.name: ARTICLE I. - PEDESTRIANS' RIGHTS AND DUTIES
1.label: article

2.catch_line: ELECTRONIC TRAFFIC AND PEDESTRIAN CONTROL SIGNALS.

next_section.catch_line: ELECTRONIC TRAFFIC AND PEDESTRIAN CONTROL SIGNALS.

plain_text:
CODE OF STATE

PEDESTRIAN CROSSING PROHIBITED. (§ 11-2152)

It shall be unlawful for any person to cross a street, on foot or by any other
means, at a point and in a manner prohibited by this section and where a sign,
barricade or other notice indicates that such crossing is prohibited. Locations
where pedestrian crossing is so prohibited shall be as designated in Traffic
Schedule No. 12, “Pedestrian Crossing Prohibited.” 
(Code 1959 , §21-17.2) 
Cross reference: Schedules incorporated by reference, §11-2004
